place.name: COMBE FLOREY
place.gazetteerText: COMBE-FLOREY, a parish in Taunton district, Somerset; adjacent to the Taunton and Watchet railway, near Bishops-Lydeard station, 5 miles NE of Wivelis-Combe. Post town, Bishops-Lydeard, under Taunton. Acres, 1, 369. Real property, £2, 584. Pop., 383. Houses, 73. Combe House is the seat of the Perrings. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £263. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is neat, and has a tower. Sydney Smith was rector. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
